sentences: Selle kergemeelse lubadusega oli ta oma sõrme kuradile andnud.
Ta ei taha oma sõrme mingisse segi ajada.
Parema meelega ei võta ta ühtegi sõrme eemale.
context: The word 'sõrme' is the partitive case form of 'sõrm', which means 'finger' in English. In Estonian, the partitive case is often used with verbs indicating partial action or when talking about a part of something rather than the whole. It can refer to any finger on the hand and follows the grammatical rules for partitive declension of nouns ending in -m.
